title: Thunderbird
content:
Kedves Címzett! Számomra nagyon zavaró, hogy a leveleket témacsoportokba rendezi a levelező program. Szeretném látni az összes levelemet, érkezési sorrendben, egymás alatt, mint eddig. Új email fiókot vettem fel a programba és itt rendezi a leveleimet, a régebben használt email fiókomnál ezt nem teszi és ezt szeretném az újonnan "regisztráltnál" is beállítani, de nem sikerül. Van olyan levelem, amit nem is látok, nem jelenik meg sehol, egyik "témában" sem, csak jelzi, hogy van egy új levelem. Lehet valahol törölni ezt a funkciót?

Köszönettel: Dr. Karcsú Noémi
creator: karcsudoki

title: Change colour of threaded messages
content:
The one big problem I have regularly with Thunderbird is losing important messages because they are hidden away in a thread. Even if I have marked them with a star this doesn't help them to be visible in my inbox. Instead I am having to guess at a suitable search term to find these messages (often support from Email addresses I do not normally correspond with). I realise I can (in theory) switch threading off (although this didn't seem to actually work for me), but I otherwise like the feature - once I have found the message, it's great to see the thread.

I would like to be able to show threads in a different colour to make them stand out in my mailbox - I realise there is a small grey symbol against threads, but this isn't very visible and doesn't seem to help.

One other possibility that might be even better, is to expand threads with unread messages, but I couldn't see a way to do this either.
creator: robin_penny

title: Open Thunderbirt in hidden mode-Windows 10
content:
I need to open Thunderbird in hidden mode. I have tried various methods but none worked. I have write vba script: Dim WShell Set WShell = CreateObject("WScript.Shell") WShell.Run """" & "C:\Program Files\Mozilla Thunderbird\thunderbird.exe" & """", 0 Set WShell = Nothing

I have tried PowerShell: Start-Process -WindowStyle hidden "C:\Program Files\Mozilla Thunderbird\thunderbird.exe"

And even the shortcut doesn't work when you select to run in minimized form.
creator: nonlinear1

title: Thunderbird Linux not a workable software
content:
I just cant find my messages anymore. cant get sorted by date, or sorted by correspondent. chaos. and this is not the first issue I have with thunderbird (linux). Right now it seems to me it is unworkable.

Been working with TB windows for many years. works fine. It too had some flaws at times but at least it works. the linux version as I see it at this point seems to have major flaws. Yes, if your emails are nowhere to be found, that is a major flaw.

Perhaps the Mozilla guys have a solution but it should be intuitive right from the start. It's the essence of using an email client.

I might change my mind about TB-Lin if someone could show me how it's done, and if there is some logic to the way it works.

Again TB Win: great. TB Lin: all thumbs down at this point. Please prove me wrong.

John.
creator: wizard.bleeker

title: Message Pane / tabs - Keep loaded?
content:
Hello,

I use Thunderbird as my RSS reader, it actually works really well, thanks Thunderbird.

However, I have one nagging annoyance. The message pane on the main page reloads if i open a new tab, actually all the tabs reload when i open a new tab.

For example, my RSS loads youtube videos in its original page, I open one in a tab, click on another, that previous tab has now unloaded, reloads when i next click on it. Is there anyway to keep the message pane and the tabs loaded, rather than reloading every time?

Any help would be amazing thank you.

title: Thunderbird losing email contents
content:
Thunderbird has lost the main body of emails from family members that I had archived over a year ago. The message subject still shows up in the archive folder, but the message content is blank when I try to view it. I am not sure when this actually happened other than to say sometime in the last 12 months.. possibly during one of the may updates to Thunderbird.

I am hoping that the message bodies are still present in the database but since I can't view then when I click on the subject, I can't be sure.

If someone knows how to recover email in this condition, please let me know. Otherwise Thunderebird team: please fix this issue!!
creator: ddenby

title: Mozilla Thunderbird running under MacOS slow performance
content:
Hi,

Lately I am experiencing slow performance in Mozilla Thunderbird. When I open a folder it takes a while before the folder is opened. In the left lower corner I see a message appearing opening folder and the Tab where the name of the folder is shown I see a point moving from left to right and back. It takes a while before this disappears. This was not like this before.

I am running: MacOS Montery 12.6.6 Mozilla Thunderbird: 102.12.0 64 bit I am using IMAPS to connect to Google Mail: imap.gmail.com port 993, SSL/TLS, oAuth2

Also on my IOS mail I am experiencing slow performance.

On the Mac I have removed endpoint protection but this didn't help. I also created a support ticket at Google Support. I have done a network test and performance is fine. No issues with other applications.

Looking forward hearing from you.

Kind Regards,

Rob
creator: Diktio

title: Outlook no longer compatible with POP or IMAP
content:
Hi there,

I've used (and liked using) Thunderbird as my email platform for more than a decade now. This morning I found out that my primary (GoDaddy supported) email account is no longer compatible with POP or IMAP settings. I've been trying to make the necessary settings changes with help from GoDaddy tech support, but they can't ensure that my contacts, emails, etc. will be saved in the process. Can you please explain how I can export/back up everything in my Thunderbird account before I make changes to the account?

Thanks,

Steve Meyer srm@interstellar-media.com

title: STAT command error
content:
TBird v102.12.0, 32bit, WIn7Ent.

Just started this morning, I'm getting the following error on one POP3 account:

The stat command did not succeed error getting message number and sizes mail server outlook.office.365.com responded server unavailable 21

This is happening only in TBird--I can get that account's email via my iPhone's built in email app--and it is happening on multiple PCs that are similarly configured.

I have multiple accounts set up on office365 (via GoDaddy). Others are working fine with the same settings.

What I have done so far, with no joy:

I have successfully logged into Office365 directly

I have regressed to an earlier version of TBird.

I have deleted and recreated the problem account (which required resetting the password). The deletion/recreation succeeded, but email will still not download for that account.

I prefer not to use IMAP.

title: MICROSOFT OUTLOOK.OFFICE365 AUTHORIZATION
content:
Please Help Need Authorization for debora@reprographicsupply.com emails to forward to our Thunderbird software, Microsoft/Outlook.office365 not responding. This morning all 5 of our emails did not work. I called godaddy (domain held with them) They had me login to godaddy & reset all 5 email accounts passwords. Then sent me back to outlook.office.com to try to login each address. It was successful. Then we went to my Thunderbird app (on Windows PC) than server settings for each email address & change Authorization to: OAuth2 Meanwhile, you sent a popup window for ...... @reprographicsupply.com to RE:Authorize forwarding the emails from MICROSOFT OUTLOOK.OFFICE365 BUT!! GODADDY TECH said ignore the popup window and cancel it. Oops, I did just that. Then she had me reboot Thunderbird & the computer. Then went back into Thunderbird & the popup window appeared again for authorizing ONLY emails to be forwarded for info, dwayne, sheila, chris but NOT debora. Info, dwayne, sheila, chris are now receiving emails in Thunderbird But Not debora. Debora can send emails from Thunderbird but cannot receive emails into Thunderbird all because the Microsoft Outlook.office365 authorization popup window no long pops up: therefore, it would be appreciated 

if you can get Microsoft/Outlook.Office365 people to email .... @reprographicsupply.com a request on our behalf, so we can authorize ...... @reprographicsupply.com emails be forwarded to our Thunderbird software. We get no response from Microsoft.

Thank you Debora Dunn [phone# removed from public]

title: Authentication error with Yahoo mail (one account fine, another not)
content:
Similar to an earlier post (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1398079), I have been using TB to connect to yahoo accounts without issue for years, but about a month ago one of two yahoo email accounts failed. Since one of the accounts still works without issue, not clear what's going on?

Ubuntu 22.04 Thunderbird 102.11.0 (64-bit)

I think perhaps it's the email account add / configuration step for several reasons. Let's call the account that works "A" and the not-working broken account "B". Early on, I deleted the "B" account and have since been trying to get this to work again. During the "add account" step, I've let TB configure automatically, which yields the same server info as "A", so I don't think that's an issue; The settings that show up when attempting to add "B" (same as "A") are in a screenshot. After you click "Done", there's a pop up to get Yahoo's password. I enter this, then click yes to the agreement, and *immediately* get the authentication error (another screenshot). The speed of this error is what has me suspicious. It made me think some local files somehow have incorrect info. I tried clearing history ("everything") and restarting, but same story.

Unfortunately, the earlier question doesn't have an answer. Any more clues about this?

Thanks in advance
creator: ryantkoehler
